New Records: Jalen Johnson scored 29 points, tying his career high
Key Match Events: Hawks pulled away for good with a 14-0 run in the middle of the fourth quarter
Pelicans were outscored 66-32 in the paint
Pre-Game Insights: Zion Williamson was scratched from the lineup with right hamstring tightness
Post-Match Reflections: Hawks snapped a four-game skid with a 126-111 victory over the short-handed New Orleans Pelicans
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jalen Johnson had three dunks during the Hawks' 14-0 run
David Roddy ignited the Hawks' 14-0 run with a 3
Others: Pelicans were without starters Dejounte Murray, CJ McCollum, and Herb Jones, along with prominent reserve Trey Murphy III
Hawks played without starter De'Andre Hunter, plus rotation players Bogdan Bogdanovic, Vit Krejci, and Kobe Bufkin due to injury
